conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on hemispheres A and B.
Hemisphere A and B are between vertical walls with a 30Â° angle between the line connecting their centers and the horizontal.
Identify forces on Hemisphere A: Weight \( W_A = mg \), Normal force \( N_A \), Frictional force \( f_A \), Contact force \( F_{AB} \).
Identify forces on Hemisphere B: Weight \( W_B = 2mg \), Normal force \( N_B \), Contact force \( F_{BA} \).
Vertical component of \( F_{BA} \) balances weight of B: \( F_{BA} = 4mg \).
Horizontal component of \( F_{AB} \) balances \( N_A \): \( N_A = 2\sqrt{3}mg \).
Vertical component of \( F_{AB} \) plus \( f_A \) balances weight of A: \( f_A = -mg \).
Take absolute value for positive friction: \( \mu = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{6} \).
Final answer: Dynamic friction coefficient is \( \frac{\sqrt{3}}{6} \).
